Drawings for Special monsters

By Thorr on Monday, October 1, 2007 - 06:04 am:

The grids we have posted for some of the specials monsters are good, but I know that I for one am having a very hard time getting them to work. the only one I have managed to get working so far is the most recent one (Fool Falco). Since these drawing need to have a little "flavor" to them in order to function, perhaps a screen shot/scan of the image from the Perfect Guide would be good to have along side it. My understanding is that there is a webspace/bandwidth issue here, though. I have 2 websites with unlimited storage and bandwidth that I can set up to host the images. Both are very permanent, so they won't disappear. What do you think?

By Lisa Shock on Monday, October 1, 2007 - 09:09 am:

So far, the drawings I have posted have mainly been ones where the entire square needs to be filled, like coloring in tiles.

There's a group of ones I haven't been able to post, well I tried one Mew, but it isn't very good, because they involve curved or diagonal lines.

We'd appreciate the hosting, I can send you images. Is it ok for me to send big pages with several, do you have time to trim them down? The main issue right now is that I'm working 65-70 hour weeks, plus commuting, so I just don't have a lot of time to work on things.

#6 - Cosmo

By Thorr on Tuesday, October 2, 2007 - 05:29 am:

I am assuming that the number in the upper left corner of these images is the Book number for the monster. The number in the upper right appears to be the page number in the guide where the info for that monster can be found. Sound right?

I will continue based on the assumption above.

By Thorr on Tuesday, October 2, 2007 - 06:16 am:

Ok, all of them are clipped, straightened, and readable. Here is the link to the parent directory (contains no page for now).

http://www.thorrsoldhammers.com/MFDS/

The drawings are divided into 4 types according to the way they are sorted in the book. I have included the type labels from the book as well. Hopefully Lisa can provide us with a translation of what they refer to (wink wink, nudge nudge). The filenames of the images correspond with the book # for the monster.

Once I get the access and the chance, I will post these as individual links in the Regeneration /Monster List area.

Note - If you go to the parent directory listed in the link, you will end up at my store.

By GM on Tuesday, October 2, 2007 - 07:33 am:

Hey, that Cosmo drawing's whay you get by copying the punchcard
dealie you get from pre-ordering the game. For some reason, I was
never able to get it right.

By Thorr on Tuesday, October 2, 2007 - 07:36 am:

True. I actually got it on my first try. :P

I don;t know if anyone has noticed or not, but the pre-order card is clearly visible on the official MFDS site. I made my drawing based on what I saw of the card there and got the special Abisu a couple of days ago.

By GM on Tuesday, October 2, 2007 - 08:17 am:

Say, Thorr, have you the classic DS, or a DS Lite?

By Thorr on Tuesday, October 2, 2007 - 08:20 am:

I have a Classic DS.

But I purchased a DS lite on Sunday, so I have both now.

By GM on Tuesday, October 2, 2007 - 08:25 am:

Ah, I see.

I'm getting the impression that, depending on the DS you use the
punchcard on, you'll get either Cosmo, the secret Gali Abisu, or the
secret Xenon.

By Thorr on Tuesday, October 2, 2007 - 08:35 am:

The card flips over, but the image is symmetrical, so it will make the Abisu in either direction.

The other monster (#176 Kao-su) has a pattern that doesn't look symmetrical, but the card itself is vertically symmetrical, so drawing that design will produce the Kao-su if the card is flipped either way.

By Thorr on Tuesday, October 2, 2007 - 08:37 am:

Let me rephrase for clarity..

It isn't vertically symmetrical, but if you rotate the card 180 degrees, the layout is the same.

By GM on Tuesday, October 2, 2007 - 08:45 am:

Ah, I see.

So both Cosmo and Chaos Xenon (that's the proper romanization)
can be regenerated via the card.

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, October 2, 2007 - 08:52 am:

Thanks for working on this!

Yes, the small number above each picture is the monster number. The numbers in the orange circle are page numbers.

BTW, it is useful here to use the newurl formatting code, rather than the regular url code. Some browsers may only open something in one of the frames with the regular url code.

By Thorr on Friday, October 19, 2007 - 10:43 am:

Translation of the description for type 4 Drawings -
Very difficult magic square. In order not to slip, while counting the grids, it probably will be best to draw little by little carefully

This applies to monsters 7,61, 157.

personally, I have managed to get only one of these 3 to work. The others give me modokis because I am not precise enough.

Type 3 translation -
As for the magic square which is introduced here, they are just a little difficult. Until you can draw the figure entirely, practice!
